unnormalised: **Question: What are some yoga practices I can incorporate into my daily routine for better well-being?**
normalised: **Question: What are some yoga practices I can incorporate into my daily routine for better well-being?**

unnormalised: Okay, so I've been practicing yoga for about 5 years now, and it's truly transformed my life. I started back in 2018 after a particularly stressful project at my IT job in Bangalore. Initially, I thought it was just stretching, but it’s so much more.
normalised: Okay, so I have been practicing yoga for about five years now, and it has truly transformed my life. I started back in two thousand and eighteen after a particularly stressful project at my I T job in Bangalore. Initially, I thought it was just stretching, but it is so much more.
Here is what I do daily:

unnormalised: First, Surya Namaskar. I aim for 12 rounds at 06:00 hrs every morning. It energizes me for the whole day!
normalised: First, Surya Namaskar. I aim for twelve rounds at six o’clock every morning. It energizes me for the whole day!

unnormalised: Then, some pranayama – specifically Kapalabhati and Anulom Vilom. Even just 10 minutes of each can make a huge difference in calming your mind. My grandmother, Dadi, swears by it and she’s turning 85 on 26/01/2024!
normalised: Then, some pranayama – specifically Kapalabhati and Anulom Vilom. Even just ten minutes of each can make a huge difference in calming your mind. My grandmother, Dadi, swears by it and she is turning eighty five on twenty sixth January two thousand and twenty four!

unnormalised: For asanas, I focus on strengthening and flexibility. Trikonasana, Virabhadrasana (Warrior pose), and Adho Mukha Svanasana (Downward-facing dog) are my go-to poses. I learned these during a workshop at the Isha Foundation in Coimbatore back in July 2020.
normalised: For asanas, I focus on strengthening and flexibility. Trikonasana, Virabhadrasana (Warrior pose), and Adho Mukha Svanasana (Downward-facing dog) are my go-to poses. I learned these during a workshop at the Isha Foundation in Coimbatore back in July two thousand and twenty.

unnormalised: Don't forget Shavasana at the end! It's so important to relax and integrate the practice. Aim for at least 5 minutes.
normalised: Do not forget Shavasana at the end! It is so important to relax and integrate the practice. Aim for at least five minutes.

unnormalised: Remember to listen to your body and don't push yourself too hard, especially when you are starting. Maybe find a good yoga instructor in your city (lots in Delhi!). Even a 30-minute practice can be incredibly beneficial. Yoga is a journey, not a destination, so enjoy the process! Good luck!
